results.title: Identification of potentially effective drugs for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease against liver cirrhosis: In-silico drug repositioning-based retrospective cohort study.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: Our findings suggest that antihypertensive drugs such as @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Isosorbide_Dinitrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007548 @@@isosorbide dinitrate@@@ may protect MASLD @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ from @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@cirrhosis@@@, providing valuable insights for clinical applications and treatment strategies.

citations.NLM: Lee CW, Kang ES, Jeong S, Han HW. Identification of potentially effective drugs for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease against liver cirrhosis: In-silico drug repositioning-based retrospective cohort study. PLoS One. 2025;20(6):e0323880. PMID: 40465795
citations.BibTeX: @article{40465795, title={Identification of potentially effective drugs for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatotic liver disease against liver cirrhosis: In-silico drug repositioning-based retrospective cohort study.}, author={Lee CW and Kang ES and Jeong S and Han HW}, journal={PLoS One}, volume={20}, number={6}, pages={e0323880}}

results.title: Atenolol hepatotoxicity: report of a complicated case.
results.text_hl: Moreover, the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ had been treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ for 3 years before LT: in the absence of any other etiology, the possibility that she had drug-induced @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@cirrhosis@@@ may therefore be considered.

citations.NLM: Dumortier J, Guillaud O, Gouraud A, Pittau G, Vial T, Boillot O, Scoazec JY. Atenolol hepatotoxicity: report of a complicated case. Ann Pharmacother. 2009 Oct;43(10):1719-23. PMID: 19776295
citations.BibTeX: @article{19776295, title={Atenolol hepatotoxicity: report of a complicated case.}, author={Dumortier J and Guillaud O and Gouraud A and Pittau G and Vial T and Boillot O and Scoazec JY}, journal={Ann Pharmacother}, volume={43}, number={10}, pages={1719-23}}

results.title: Antenatal exposure to atenolol and retroperitoneal fibromatosis.
results.text_hl: This in utero exposure to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ drew our attention because the retroperitoneal localization of the @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ is similar to that of @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibroses@@@ reported in adults after exposure to @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and for other reasons: transplacental @DISEASE_Carcinogenesis @DISEASE_MESH:D063646 @@@carcinogenesis@@@ has been demonstrated in @SPECIES_9606 @@@humans@@@, at least for @CHEMICAL_Diethylstilbestrol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004054 @@@diethylstilboestrol@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ crosses the placental barrier, the drug was taken during nearly the whole pregnancy, and @DISEASE_Fibroma @DISEASE_MESH:D005350 @@@retroperitoneal fibromatosis@@@ is exceptional as a @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@neonatal tumour@@@.

citations.NLM: Satgé D, Sasco AJ, Col JY, Lemonnier PG, Hemet J, Robert E. Antenatal exposure to atenolol and retroperitoneal fibromatosis. Reprod Toxicol. 1997 Jul-Aug;11(4):539-41. PMID: 9241674
citations.BibTeX: @article{9241674, title={Antenatal exposure to atenolol and retroperitoneal fibromatosis.}, author={Satgé D and Sasco AJ and Col JY and Lemonnier PG and Hemet J and Robert E}, journal={Reprod Toxicol}, volume={11}, number={4}, pages={539-41}}

results.title: Septal panniculitis induced by atenolol--a case report.
results.text_hl: The dramatic @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ involvement of the subcutaneous @DISEASE_Connective_Tissue_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003240 @@@connective tissue@@@ could have eventually progressed toward @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@, if @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ had not been withdrawn.

citations.NLM: Fragasso G, Ciboddo G, Pagnotta P, Chierchia SL. Septal panniculitis induced by atenolol--a case report. Angiology. 1998 Jun;49(6):499-502. PMID: 9631898
citations.BibTeX: @article{9631898, title={Septal panniculitis induced by atenolol--a case report.}, author={Fragasso G and Ciboddo G and Pagnotta P and Chierchia SL}, journal={Angiology}, volume={49}, number={6}, pages={499-502}}

results.title: Role of endogenous beta-adrenergic mechanism in the pathogenesis of spontaneous myocardial fibrosis in rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ did not prevent development of @DISEASE_Mouth_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D009059 @@@myocardial lesions@@@ in both sexes, whereas it significantly promoted @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ in the medium and high dose groups of male @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ but not at any dose levels in female animals.

citations.NLM: Yoshimura S, Hashimoto K. Role of endogenous beta-adrenergic mechanism in the pathogenesis of spontaneous myocardial fibrosis in rats. Tohoku J Exp Med. 1988 Aug;155(4):327-33. PMID: 2852856
citations.BibTeX: @article{2852856, title={Role of endogenous beta-adrenergic mechanism in the pathogenesis of spontaneous myocardial fibrosis in rats.}, author={Yoshimura S and Hashimoto K}, journal={Tohoku J Exp Med}, volume={155}, number={4}, pages={327-33}}

results.title: Comparison of three adrenoreceptor blocking agents in patients with cirrhosis and portal hypertension.
results.text_hl: Comparison of three adrenoreceptor blocking agents in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@cirrhosis@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension_Portal @DISEASE_MESH:D006975 @@@portal hypertension@@@.

citations.NLM: Mills PR, Rae AP, Farah DA, Russell RI, Lorimer AR, Carter DC. Comparison of three adrenoreceptor blocking agents in patients with cirrhosis and portal hypertension. Gut. 1984 Jan;25(1):73-8. PMID: 6360815
citations.BibTeX: @article{6360815, title={Comparison of three adrenoreceptor blocking agents in patients with cirrhosis and portal hypertension.}, author={Mills PR and Rae AP and Farah DA and Russell RI and Lorimer AR and Carter DC}, journal={Gut}, volume={25}, number={1}, pages={73-8}}

results.title: Attenuation of hypertension, cardiomyocyte hypertrophy, and myocardial fibrosis by beta-adrenoceptor blockers in rats under long-term blockade of nitric oxide synthesis.
results.text_hl: Treatment with @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@L-NAME@@@ induced marked @DISEASE_Pulmonary_Arterial_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D000081029 @@@arterial hypertension@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D006984 @@@cardiomyocyte hypertrophy@@@, both of which were significantly reduced by @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. A marked repairing @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ was also observed in @CHEMICAL_NG_Nitroarginine_Methyl_Ester @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019331 @@@L-NAME@@@-treated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ and this was significantly attenuated in animals receiving the beta-blockers.

citations.NLM: Pacca SR, de Azevedo AP, De Oliveira CF, De Luca IM, De Nucci G, Antunes E. Attenuation of hypertension, cardiomyocyte hypertrophy, and myocardial fibrosis by beta-adrenoceptor blockers in rats under long-term blockade of nitric oxide synthesis. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 2002 Feb;39(2):201-7. PMID: 11791005
citations.BibTeX: @article{11791005, title={Attenuation of hypertension, cardiomyocyte hypertrophy, and myocardial fibrosis by beta-adrenoceptor blockers in rats under long-term blockade of nitric oxide synthesis.}, author={Pacca SR and de Azevedo AP and De Oliveira CF and De Luca IM and De Nucci G and Antunes E}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={39}, number={2}, pages={201-7}}

results.title: Nebivolol induces distinct changes in profibrosis microRNA expression compared with atenolol, in salt-sensitive hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@Nebivolol@@@ substantially attenuated @DISEASE_Ventricular_Remodeling @DISEASE_MESH:D020257 @@@cardiac remodeling@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D006984 @@@hypertrophy@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@ more than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Ye H, Ling S, Castillo AC, Thomas B, Long B, Qian J, Perez-Polo JR, Ye Y, Chen X, Birnbaum Y. Nebivolol induces distinct changes in profibrosis microRNA expression compared with atenolol, in salt-sensitive hypertensive rats. Hypertension. 2013 May;61(5):1008-13. PMID: 23460283

results.title: Cardioprotective effect of Amaranthus tricolor extract in isoprenaline induced myocardial damage in ovariectomized rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ and A. tricolor treatment prevented the @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ cells infiltration, @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@fibrosis@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Iron @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007501 @@@iron@@@ deposition.

citations.NLM: Nahar K, Kabir F, Islam P, Rahman MM, Al Mamun MA, Faruk M, Subhan N, Rahman GMS, Reza HM, Alam MA. Cardioprotective effect of Amaranthus tricolor extract in isoprenaline induced myocardial damage in ovariectomized rats. Biomed Pharmacother. 2018 Jul;103():1154-1162. PMID: 29715759

results.title: Sustained beta-AR stimulation induces synthesis and secretion of growth factors in cardiac myocytes that affect on cardiac fibroblast activation.
results.text_hl: Thus, the use of beta-blockers may have beneficial effects on the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Fibrosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005355 @@@myocardial fibrosis@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@.
